DINNERTODAYNIGHT:=Buyingslops=[twice]*Student Calls[buying]=2∗sumofallcallsfromfriends⇒BUYSLAPS=2∗SumofAllstudentCallies&mornemissesume×dinnermissesume→MORNEDINEREMBURSEMENT=MANU

1.subquestion: How many lollipops does Oscar pass out to his friends?

subanswer.text: First we need to find out how many lollipops Oscar passed out to his friends before any additional purchases or consumption. Consequently, when articulating the solution while adhering strictly to both accuracy and succinctness appropriate for informative communication regarding discrete data points derived from text, I would respond thusly following thorough examination and interpretation: Initial distribution among peers amounted to fourteen units; henceforth designated mathematically using base ten digits encapsulated herein — forty.

2.subquestion: Now we can calculate how many lollipops Oscar bought.

subanswer.text: To determine how many lollipops Oscar purchased, multiply the number of lollipops he gifted to friends by two since it states “he buys twice as many.” That equates to \( 14 \times 2 = 28 \) additional lollipops acquired post their allocation. direct_answer.text:
